channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023061534
item.description:
Report X-2023061534

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 8:30AM a package was brought over by a driver, who said it was left under the belt line. DescribePack: Cap burst off on 1 gallon. Dents on bottoms of all containers suggest it sustained a drop. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Nothing was done properly. Management was notified that not only did the driver bring it over himself, but the package handler had left it under the belt system and never notified QA.

item.title: Report X-2023061113
item.description:
Report X-2023061113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-12
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was packed wrong, the bottles upside down. when a package handler moved the box and set it hard on the ground the caps broke and some of the liquid leaked out. the box was immediately moved into a black tote and in a plastic spill bag. DescribePack: the bottles caps and seals failed due to being shippen with the bottle's upside down. putting more pressure on the seals and caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the shipment was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote.

item.title: Report E-2023060742
item.description:
Report E-2023060742

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of razorlube (un1268) had a loose bung cap and had released 3 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
